DOC.brief_summary: Opioids are commonly used to treat migraine in North American Emergency Departments. We are comparing efficacy and adverse events of hydromorphone, an opioid, to that of prochlorperazine, a dopamine antagonist with known efficacy in migraine. Prochlorperazine will be combined with diphenhydramine to prevent adverse events.
DOC.brief_title: Hydromorphone Versus Prochlorperazine + Diphenhydramine for Acute Migraine
DOC.criteria: Migraine headache (International Classification of Headache Disorders 3B criteria) Brain imaging ordered Fever Objective neurological findings Pregnancy/ breast feeding Allergy/ contraindication to investigational medication History of addiction to opioids, use of methadone, any use of opioids previous 30 days
